template.p:
This setup is for association organizing events and offering membership program.
They have a website where people can:

ol.li: Fill a form to request membership. Or buy membership directly on the eCommerce.
See planned event and by registration ticket.
Make a donation of their preferred amount.

template.p: In addition, the organization use the email marketing application to send news about upcoming events.

div.a: CRM: Manage opportunity & create a quotation
Subscription: Track progress and renew subscription

template.p:
On the website page "[...].odoo.com/contactus", visitor can fill a form.
When the form is completed, a CRM opportunity will be created and the admin will get a mail notification.
template.h3: CRM: Manage opportunity & create a quotation
template.p:
On the CRM Pipeline, you can see the created opportunity. You can communicate with prospect and change the opportunity stage.
Eventually, you can create a quotation for the customer by clicking on "New Quotation".

ul.li: Product "Membership" should be added as product

template.p:
Then, you can click on button "Send by mail".
Be careful not to click on "confirm", as it would start the subscription even though the customer hasn't stat paying.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p:
When sending via mail, user can load template "Sales: Send Quotation (membership)".
That way, the mail body will tell the customer to create an account on the website.

template.p:
Customer will receive a quotation email with a link to the customer portal. On the portal, he can pay.
His payment details will be saved, the order will be confirmed and the subscription will start.
Before or after paying, customer should also create an account by going to page [...].odoo.com/web/signup

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-warning pb-0 pt-3

div.p:
Don't forget to enable payment provider, in the video we used the "demo" provider that accepts any data.
You can do that in Sales -> Configuration -> Payment Provider.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-success pb-0 pt-3

div.p:
As soon as the payment is done, the order will be confirmed and the subscription start.
Also, thanks to an automated actions, the customer pricelist will be updated to "Member"

template.h3: Subscription: Track progress and renew subscription
template.p: You can look at ongoing plans in the subscription app. There you can easily communicate with customers and renew soon to expire membership.
Using the event app, you can create events that will be visible on the website. There is one already created to show you how it looks.

The product "Event Registration" can be used as ticket. It is configured to have a default price of 30$.
The "Member" pricelist will overwrite the sale price to 10$. Remember that this pricelist is automatically applied to customer with ongoing membership subscription.
The button "Go to website" will allow you to publish your event and to design your event website page.
Your customers can purchase event ticket. If they are logged in, the pricelist assigned to their customers will automatically apply and the ticket will be cheaper.
Later on, in the event application, you can communicate to participant & track attendance.
You can easily add a donation form on your website by using our building block. We created a page that you can access on yourdatabase.odoo.com/donation .
Online visitors will be able to get money to your association in just a few steps.
Later, you can see all payments received in Accounting->Customers->Payments.
You can use the filter "Donations" in the favourite to filter only donations payments.

Using the email marketing, you can easily communicate with stakeholders.
For example, you can use the filter we created to communicate with paying members.
